casebody.data:
CARILLON
v.
NCDHHS, et al. No. 54A06. Supreme Court of North Carolina. July 25, 2006. Melissa L. Trippe, Special Deputy Attorney General, Thomas M. Woodward, Susan *296K. Hackney, Assistant Attorney Generals, for NCDHHS. Jim W. Phillips, Jr., Forrest W. Campbell, Jr., Greensboro, Charles F. Marshall, III, for Carillon Assistant Living.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 24th day of July 2006 by Defendants for Extension of Time to File Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Defendants (N.C. DHHS and Adult Care Licensure) shall have up to and including the 30th day of August 2006 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court. By order of the Court in conference this the 25th day of July 2006."
